Yes, the airplane that landed on the beach wasn't actually from Towing,
the same type of plane, a Hawker Henley.
It was a Hawker Henley on loan to the Rolls Royce company

which was being developed at that time,
being put into, hopefully into the Avro Manchester,
forerunner of the Lancaster.
And it was put into a Hawker Henley to fly around the country to test it.
